to be honest I don't know what I am using

yes, do the following: 1) sudo aptitude purge flashplugin-installer 2) go to http://labs.adobe.com/downloads/flashplayer10.html and download the tar.gz for 64-bit 3) extract the libflashplayer.so to ~/.mozilla/plugins
this means however it will be up to you to maintain it and keep it up to date (for security issues, etc) as with all software installed outside the repositories

~ means /home/YOUR_USERNAME usually.  Directories that start with a '.' like ".mozilla" are hidden by default.  You can show hidden directories in nautilus by either pressing ctrl-h or going to view â†’ show hidden files.  If you do not have a ~/.mozilla/plugins, create it
After placing the 'libflashplayer.so' in ~/.mozilla/plugins/ I re-opened my Firefox and tried to watch a video but it prompted me that I am 'Missing Plugins".
I refreshed the page and it appeared.
